author: Rick Stein
name: Stir-fried Water Spinach with Garlic and Fish Sauce (Rau muong xao toi)
ingredients:
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 8 cloves garlic, 6 left whole, 2 finely chopped
- 450g water spinach (morning glory)
- 1 tbsp fish sauce
instructions:
- Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a small pan over a medium heat, add the whole garlic cloves and stir-fry until they have taken a good colour all over. Lower the heat, add 1 tbsp water, cover and cook for a few minutes until they are sweet and tender. Set aside.
- Cut away the root of the water spinach if necessary and then cut the remainder into appoximately 10cm lengths. Drop into a large pan of boiling salted water, bring back to the boil, then drain, reserving some of the cooking water, and refresh under cold water. Drain well.
- Heat the remaining oil in a wok over a medium-high heat. Add the chopped garlic and cook until it is just starting to change colour. Add the morning glory and the whole garlic cloves, increase the heat to high and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the fish sauce, toss together briefly and serve straight away.
